properties.name: Hot New Kid
properties.description: Posted by Testytester Fort Dodge, IAI can\'t even remember his name now, but I had a really big crush on this guy senior year of high school. He was the new boy in town, from Wisconsin. I tried and tried to seduce him but it was hopeless. I ended up going out with his best friend a couple times, but that was awful. of course.

properties.name: Madrid
properties.description: Posted by ChilmoeEvery crush I had when I was a teen was secret - I was too shy to speak to anyone in high school. Have gotten over that now and it helps being older, now I don\'t really care who I talk to!

properties.name: Miss Dawsons French Class
properties.description: Posted by ChilmoeIn eighth grade (circa 1969), I sat at the back of Miss Dawson\'s French Class next to Rich G. He and I passed notes and generally acted up. I remember Miss Dawson\'s attention, so I know this really happened, but in hindsight seems weird. Under normal circumstances, I was obedient and would never misbehave in public. But these weren\'t normal circumstances, clearly. Years later, traveling internationally and other times, I would sense regret that I hadn\'t taken my foreign languages more seriously growing up. Then I think about Miss Dawson. Of all the language teachers I had, she was the best and I had absolutely no idea or understanding of this at the time. I was clearly too preoccupied. BTW, Rich didn\'t turn out to be worth it.

properties.name: Steve S. and the Hershey Kiss
properties.description: Posted by ChilmoeThomas Pyle Junior High School, Bethesda, Maryland, USA. One day in 7th or 8th grade (circa 1969), I was sitting in the school cafeteria with my friends Leslie G. and Vibeke Hj. Vibeke was the daughter of a Danish diplomat. A lot of diplomats\' kids attended our D.C. suburban schools. Steve S. often came by towards the end of lunch to visit with us. I had the biggest crush on him. He rode to school on a 10-speed bike --- I really wanted a bike like that instead of my 3-speed. He had the greatest eyes....soft and deep. His hair was long and curly. He had a lope in his gait. Even today, I wonder whatever happened to him. No google results sort of scare me. This particular day, I handed him a Hershey\'s kiss. I don\'t remember planning this in advance. Thinking back, such a "bold" move was not in my nature. I don\'t remember how he acknowledged me, but I do remember that an instant later he handed the kiss to Vibeke. She was sort of exotic and I guess he had a crush on her. That may have been the first time I minimized my feelings towards a romantic interest since I don\'t remember even being embarrassed or aggravated by what now seems, in hindsight, a rather cruel or thoughtless act on Steve\'s part. Ah, but this is what being a teenager means. I think I may be a Valentine\'s Day Scrooge. Maybe this was the beginning.

properties.name: first date!
properties.description: Posted by ChilmoeThis park is called ARISUGAWANOMIYA Park,which came from a name of royal family.My high school is very close from here. In 1980,when Meredith was born,I often dated with girls during the classes...It was really thrilled.Because sometimes I saw some teachers in the park... This place is still very international area in Tokyo. We saw many foreign kids and talked about our futures. Just talked! Sweet old days...
